clauses.question: 1. What process should the Government use to set a new emissions reduction target in legislation?
clauses.notes: No process required , this is a meaningless , time wasting , money wasting proposal .

clauses.question: 2. If the Government sets a 2050 target now, which is the best target for New Zealand?
clauses.notes:
No target required until the China , India , USA , and several others set targets , these governments represent around 3 billion people
 , about 45% of the worlds population .

clauses.question: 3. How should New Zealand meet its targets?
clauses.notes:
Start counting all of the emission mitigating assets we currently have , starting with all native bush , it's likely we are close to carbon

 neutral today if this was done .

clauses.question: 4. Should the Zero Carbon Bill allow the 2050 target to be revised if circumstances change?
clauses.notes:
No need to revise anything , a Carbon bill should only introduced if the world can agree on a joint way to move in the same direction ,
 that's not close to happening , in fact the reverse is happening .

clauses.question: 5. The Government proposes that three emissions budgets of five years each (i.e. covering the next 15 years) be in place at any given time. Do you agree with this proposal?
6. Should the Government be able to alter the last emissions budget (i.e. furthest into the future)?
clauses.notes:
Yes , If this unwarranted zero carbon bill becomes law , the government of the day must have the right to make changes without
 changes having to go threw parliament . The RMA is a classic case of getting it wrong , it needs changing but no political party can

 get the numbers to make change so we are stuck with something designed for a past era , another example in the USA , gun laws
 clearly need changing but again no political party can make the changes , they are trapped for ever . Don't make the same mistake
 here .

clauses.question: 7. Should the Government have the ability to review and adjust the second emissions budget within a specific range under exceptional circumstances? See p36 Our Climate Your Say
clauses.notes: A government must have total authority to make any adjustments it feels are necessary under any circumstances .

clauses.question: 8. Do you agree with the considerations we propose that the Government and the Climate Change Commission take into account when advising on and setting budgets? See p44 Our Climate Your Say
clauses.notes:
Step one , the most important , ascertain what is really happening around the world before we do anything . A good starting point ,

what's China doing ?, no commitment until 2030 and no commitment to ever stop using coal . Currently Chinas emissions are on
track for their fastest growth in the last 7 years .

clauses.question: 9. Should the Zero Carbon Bill require Governments to set out plans within a certain timeframe to achieve the emissions budgets?
clauses.notes: At this time we shouldn't have a zero carbon bill

clauses.question: 10. What are the most important issues for the Government to consider in setting plans to meet budgets? For example, who do we need to work with, what else needs to be considered?
clauses.notes:
Important to check out what the rest of the world is actually doing , get real facts not the fairy tales . If we do this first and are honest
with those facts this bill will be filed in the rubbish bin .

clauses.question: 11. The Government has proposed that the Climate Change Commission advises on and monitors New Zealand's progress towards its goals. Do you agree with these functions? See p42 Our Climate Your Say
12. What role do you think the Climate Change Commission should have in relation to the New Zealand Emissions Trading Scheme (NZ ETS)?
clauses.notes: No role and NZ should follow Ontario Canada and scrap the ETS .

clauses.question: 13. The Government has proposed that Climate Change Commissioners need to have a range of essential and desirable expertise. Do you agree with the proposed expertise? See p45 Our Climate Your Say
clauses.notes:
The ability to study , follow and understand what the rest of the world is really doing is the first essential requirement . An example ,
About 18 months ago China made much noise about closing coal mines , they closed them but forgot to tell anyone (or it wasn't

reported ) that 3 months later they reopened them . Trialled an ETS , this was designed to get industry to move into the country side
not to stop polluting , stopping polluting would have been financial suicide for China , they are going to grow richer at the rest of the
worlds expense .

clauses.question: 14. Do you think the Zero Carbon Bill should cover adapting to climate change?
clauses.notes:
The climate change today is no different to any climate change that's happened in the past , climate changes , that's what it's always
done , the only difference today is , today it's an industry , there is money in it .

clauses.question: 15. The Government has proposed a number of new functions to help us adapt to climate change. Do you agree with the proposed functions? See p47 Our Climate Your Say
clauses.notes: So far any actual climate change is at the bottom of predictions , far to many predictions have proven to be woefully inaccurate .

clauses.question: 16. Should we explore setting up a targeted adaptation reporting power that could see some organisations share information on their exposure to climate change risks?
Do you have any other comments you'd like to make?
clauses.notes:
World realities , Australia exports record amounts of coal , $57 BILLION last year , growth of 400 million tons in the next 15 years .

1000plus coal fired power stations planned for or being built now around the world , 423 in China alone . Not one European country
meeting it's Paris targets . Emissions skyrocketing in China at the moment , fossil fuels values have over taken over the tech industry

on the financial markets , almost a half of the world population has no commitment to cutting emissions , the UN climate fund chief
resigns quoting fighting over how the fund that we are going to paying $1 BILLION a year into is spent .(I guess that's enough for

starters) To finish , this bill is just an attempt by certain political partys to dominate our lives , put a noose around our necks for the
next 32 years for no good reason , what's actually happening around the world proves it's for no good reason .
